title: Volexity Catches Chinese Hackers Exploiting Ivanti VPN Zero-Days
description:
Ivanti confirms active zero-day exploits, ships pre-patch mitigations, but says comprehensive fixes won't be available until January 22.

The post Volexity Catches Chinese Hackers Exploiting Ivanti VPN Zero-Days appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: ExtraHop Banks $100M in Growth Funding, Adds New Execs
description:
Seattle network detection and response firm secures $100 million in growth funding and adds to its executive team.

The post ExtraHop Banks $100M in Growth Funding, Adds New Execs appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: HMG Healthcare Says Data Breach Impacts 40 Facilities
description:
The compromised information includes names, contact information, dates of birth, health information, medical treatment details, Social Security numbers, and employee records.

The post HMG Healthcare Says Data Breach Impacts 40 Facilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: French Computer Hacker Jailed in US
description:
A computer hacker who was part of a criminal gang that stole data from hundreds of millions of people and sold it on the dark web was jailed in the United States on Tuesday.

The post French Computer Hacker Jailed in US appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Anecdotes Raises $25 Million for Enterprise GRC Platform
description:
Anecdotes has raised $25 million in Series B funding, which brings the total investment to $55 million, for its compliance platform.

The post Anecdotes Raises $25 Million for Enterprise GRC Platform appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Kyocera Device Manager Vulnerability Exposes Enterprise Credentials
description:
An improper input validation flaw in Kyocera Device Manager allows attackers to capture credentials, compromise accounts.

The post Kyocera Device Manager Vulnerability Exposes Enterprise Credentials appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: SAP’s First Patches of 2024 Resolve Critical Vulnerabilities
description:
SAP has released patches for critical vulnerabilities in Business Application Studio, Web IDE, and Edge Integration Cell.

The post SAP’s First Patches of 2024 Resolve Critical Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Dutch Engineer Used Water Pump to Get Billion-Dollar Stuxnet Malware Into Iranian Nuclear Facility: Report
description:
An engineer recruited by intelligence services used a water pump to deliver Stuxnet, which reportedly cost $1-2 billion to develop.

The post Dutch Engineer Used Water Pump to Get Billion-Dollar Stuxnet Malware Into Iranian Nuclear Facility: Report appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: China Says State-Backed Experts Crack Apple’s AirDrop
description:
Chinese state-backed experts have found a way to identify people who use Apple's encrypted AirDrop messaging service, according to the Beijing municipal government.

The post China Says State-Backed Experts Crack Apple’s AirDrop appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Android’s January 2024 Security Update Patches 58 Vulnerabilities
description:
Android’s first security update of 2024 resolves high-severity elevation of privilege and information disclosure vulnerabilities.

The post Android’s January 2024 Security Update Patches 58 Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: SEC Chair Says Account on X Was Hacked
description:
The SEC said that a post on X, announcing that the securities regulator had approved the trading of exchange-traded funds holding bitcoin was fake, and that the agency’s account had been “compromised.”

The post SEC Chair Says Account on X Was Hacked appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise to Acquire Juniper Networks for $14 Billion
description:
This acquisition is expected to double HPE's networking business and expand its portfolio with AI-native networking offerings.

The post Hewlett Packard Enterprise to Acquire Juniper Networks for $14 Billion appeared first on SecurityWeek.
